Class FileRetrieverClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileRetrieverClient

  • public class FileRetrieverClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the client for a networking transaction. This client specifies the file wanted to transfer over to a path specified on the client machine.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String fileNameWanted
      A file name passed in through the constructor to indicate to the server which file is to be transferred
      private java.lang.String fileOutput
      A file name passed in through the constructor to indicate what the resulting file should be named
      private java.lang.String hostName
      The host name of the server for the socket
      private java.io.ObjectInputStream inputStream
      The stream used to input from the server
      private java.io.ObjectOutputStream outputStream
      The stream used to output to the server
      private int portNum
      The number of the port used for the socket
      private java.net.Socket serverConnection
      The client socket used for the file transfer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileRetrieverClient(java.lang.String hostName, int portNum, java.lang.String fileNameWanted, java.lang.String fileOutput)
      Constructor for the Client

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void connectAndStream()
      Called by the start() method to create input and output Object streams connected to the host
      private void getFileBytesFromServer()
      Called by the start() method to recieve bytes from a specified file to the the fileOutputStream which puts the bytes into the file speciefied by the class fileOutput variable.
      void start()
      Creates a socket to connect the specified port of the specified IP address, input and output steams to communicate with the server, and a file stream to output the file contents into from the server.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileRetrieverClient

        public FileRetrieverClient(java.lang.String hostName,
                           int portNum,
                           java.lang.String fileNameWanted,
                           java.lang.String fileOutput)
        Constructor for the Client
        Parameters:
        hostName - the IP address for the server
        portNum - the port number used for the server machine
        fileNameWanted - the name of the file wanted
        fileOutput - the name that will be created and written to on the client machine

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public final void start()
        Creates a socket to connect the specified port of the specified IP address, input and output steams to communicate with the server, and a file stream to output the file contents into from the server.

      • connectAndStream

        private void connectAndStream()
                       throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                              java.io.IOException
        Called by the start() method to create input and output Object streams connected to the host
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException
        java.io.IOException

      • getFileBytesFromServer

        private void getFileBytesFromServer()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Called by the start() method to recieve bytes from a specified file to the the fileOutputStream which puts the bytes into the file speciefied by the class fileOutput variable.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
